page.title: 11ROSEDALE MIDDLE SCHOOL 1
page.content: Our school was opened in 1976 and can accommodate 240 children aged 8 - 12. At present there are 148 on roll. It has one storey and there are eight classrooms, two shared areas, a hall, a medical room, two offices and a staffroom where the teachers have a break. The basic shape from an aerial view is a square but bits stick out like the kitchen and the boiler-house. The outside of the building is covered in brown pebble-dash and the doors, which are all double, are painted orange and are set back into the walls to make a sort of porch. On the school roof there are some large square plastic pyramids which let in light. There are two playgrounds and one has a netball pitch on it. There is also a large wooden storage shed, a greenhouse and a large playing field.
